content: hey crafters welcome to another edition of the zombie apocalypse team scrapped
bids and today I was going to talk about 2.5 D modern buildings what I'm going to
show you today are the basic buildings themselves I've got some other things
that I'm working on that I'll talk about in the video itself but I'm just showing
you the basic buildings themselves and that the technique is just very similar
to the dungeon tiles we're just kind of adding a modern twist to them so let's
go the table I'll show you what I got here you can see I have some modern
tiles I'm working on and they're really not much different from the regular
tiles one big difference that I've the thought of was that a lot of modern
buildings will have a glass front so I made this big area that I'm going to
simulate glass in and I'll show you how to do that later
alright so there's my tiles and I'm gonna paint those up and show you what
they look like my first tile here looks very much like
a dungeon tile but you will notice that I haven't used the texture paint on it
basically I painted it black and then hit it with some gray primer and of
course I did all the techniques of highlighting the walls adding the
shadows to the tiles and that kind of thing now you will notice that I did do
the floor a different color so it's like a blue grey as opposed to like the gray
of the walls which I was one for the cinder block look as most buildings
right most buildings that are commercial buildings are cinder block but you will
notice the big difference as I mentioned earlier and that is this big gap here
okay now I'm going to make some glass simulate glass for the front of the
building and I'll show that in a later bit but I wanted to show these tiles
first off and show what they look like so now we'll move onto the next tile now
this tile is pretty interesting you can see that I have the cinder block colored
walls but I've done the floor like a tannish Brown and you'll notice that in
like kind of commercial buildings that they try to do the floor like a neutral
color like a grey or you know off grey or some kind of brown because that way
it doesn't show dirt so you'll often see that in commercial type buildings and
then I have the big opening as the other buildings so I will do a video on
showing how to do those that glass front there and then on the side here it looks
like something smashed the wall which I thought was pretty sweet I also had this
is a two-part tile so it will have the smashed wall and then the open front
here but I have a back area which will have a regular door won't have a glass
door and as you can see these are two separate tiles so they can just go
together like that okay so that's our second tile and let's move on to the
next one on this tile I did a different floor
technique and you can see that it's like a
checkerboard pattern I just use a sponge cut into a square and then dipped it
with a white paint and then just stamped it on the tile itself so it gives that
kind of checkerboard pattern but it also gave a nice look of being old and
scuffed up because it's not a solid solid pattern so I thought that was kind
of nice also you notice something different I did different on this tile
was I am having a back door which will be a solid door and then I'm going to
have two front doors as opposed to a glass front and the two front doors will
be glass doors but it won't have a glass front so that would be kind of nice and
that's the next tile let's move your the let's move to another one now here we go
this is a much smaller tile compared to the others and we only have one entrance
as you can see I was thinking like a power station room a kind of thing that
you'll see out in residential neighborhoods now you also noticed I did
I did the same techniques as I did the other but I also added something cool
here with the caution sign I thought that'd be kind of neat to put on a floor
and all I did for that was laser print that graphic that I grabbed off the web
of course a plinth painted in black and white so I just washed on the yellow
with a light yellow crap paint wash a little black on it with the black paint
too just a touch and then I just glued it on with a white glue so you just
saturate the back of the paper with a white glue slide it on and you're good
to go it looks like it's right on there it's not never going to come off so
there we go those there are some of our modern tiles and I'll see you next time
on the craft I want to mention a couple of things that I didn't necessarily
mention in the video one was that when I did the different color colored floors I
actually just used the color watered down I didn't spray it or anything so I
sprayed the tiles black like normal then I hit them with a little bit of I dusted
them with the gray primer and then what fluor I use acrylic craft paint but I've
watered it down so I washed it i watch the floor so it kind of gave that look
of not being a solid it gave a kind of an older look so I like that also I
wanted to mention that after I finished the tiles bow before I put the shadows
on I just sprayed the tiles of touch with the texture paint I wasn't trying
to get the texture on there just trying to get the Fleck because the flecks from
the paint would I would hold it pretty far back from the tile and the Flex from
that texture paint would really add a nice kind of look of old and dingy to
the tile so I did that too so I did those a couple techniques I didn't
really talk about in the video but I did want to mention so now I'm really
leaving see you next time hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this
episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
